definition: time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: Time is not on our side. We need to keep moving forward and we need to move fast.
sentences.chinese: 時不我待，我們必須不斷前進，行動迅速。

sentences.english: Many bold decisions need to be taken, and taken soon.
sentences.chinese: 需要作出許多具有膽識的決定，而且時不我待。

sentences.english: I must point out, however, that time waits for no one, so we must take action immediately.
sentences.chinese: 但是需要指出的是，時不我待，必須馬上行動。

sentences.english: Yet the euro crisis will not wait.
sentences.chinese: 但是歐債危機已經時不我待。

sentences.english: So treasure every moment that you have. And remember that time waits for no one.
sentences.chinese: 所以珍惜你擁有的每一刻，切記住時不我待。

sentences.english: Indeed this is need of the hour can't wait or pause the modernisation for anbyody.
sentences.chinese: 這個的確是當前需要，軍隊現代化時不我待。

sentences.english: This responsibility cannot wait – we must act now.
sentences.chinese: 這一責任時不我待，我們必須現在就行動起來。

definition: to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
Brave New World, novel by Aldous Huxley 阿道司·赫胥黎[A1 dao4 si1 · He4 xu1 li2]
millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
